page.title: 15The Rose Queen
page.content: The Rose Queen was started in 1941 by Mrs E Sheppard and Mrs E Maddock. They wanted to start it because it would give Saughall some pleasure. The very first Rose Queen was Anne Huges who now lives in New Zealand with some of her family.They used to wear plain white bride's dresses, a bit like today. It had a very small connection with the Saughall Parish Church. People used to come and watch the Rose Queen. It was first held at Shotwick House when Mr. Tickle was warden.They still have Rose Queens today and this year in 1985 it was Rachel Jones from Thomas Wedge Junior School. It all started from the May Fairs many years ago. The Rose Queen has now been going for 15 years. "Although very nervous I enjoyed my day when I was crowned at the vicarage Garden Fete." Rachel Jones.
